Breakfast.meal: Moong Dal Cheela with Steamed Vegetables
Breakfast.description: 2 small moong dal cheelas (made with low-sodium spices) served with a mix of steamed carrots, green beans, and spinach.

Snack.description: 1 cup of homemade buttermilk (unsweetened and low-sodium).

Lunch.description: 1 cup cooked khichdi made with brown rice, moong dal, and low-sodium vegetables like carrots, peas, and cauliflower. Served with a dollop of low-fat curd.

Evening.description: 1 medium apple, sliced, sprinkled with a pinch of cinnamon.

Dinner.meal: Mashed Sweet Potato with Palak Paneer
Dinner.description: 1/2 cup mashed sweet potato (cooked without added sugar) served with 1/2 cup palak paneer (made with low-sodium paneer and spinach).

Dinner.meal: Mashed Sweet Potato with Steamed Broccoli
Dinner.description: 1 cup mashed sweet potato (cooked without added sugar or salt) served with 1 cup steamed broccoli florets.

Lunch.meal: Masoor Dal Khichdi with Cucumber Raita
Lunch.description: 1 cup cooked masoor dal khichdi with brown rice, lightly spiced with turmeric and ginger. Served with 1/2 cup cucumber raita made with low-fat yogurt.

Evening.description: A mixed salad of sprouted moong beans, chickpeas, and lentils, dressed with a squeeze of lemon juice and a sprinkle of chopped coriander.

Dinner.description: 1 cup vegetable pulao made with brown rice, mixed vegetables (avoiding high potassium vegetables), and low-sodium spices. Served with 100g steamed fish.
